A Christmas stocking is a cloth stocking that is traditionally hung on the fireplace mantel or a wall on Christmas Eve. It is used to hold small gifts and treats that Santa Claus brings for children on Christmas morning. The tradition of hanging a Christmas stocking is believed to have originated in Europe, where children would leave their stockings out to be filled with gifts from Saint Nicholas.
